name: Design Hotel Josef Prague

reviews.text: Lovely hotel in a great location just minutes from Wenceslas Square. Very chic foyer with minimalistic decor.
reviews.title: Good Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms have glass walled bathrooms as a feature, similar design to those of The Sanderson Hotel in London, . Aveda products plentiful. Robes, Slippers and bottled water also provided.
reviews.title: Staff made a great hotel even better

likes.liked: — Clean Hotel, Professional staff. Great design, Perfect location

reviews.text: Excellent choice & selection at the breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: This is a FANTASTIC and surprisingly child-friendly hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge made dinner reservation on our behalf at U Modre Kachnicky restaurant, which was superb offering a varied selection of traditional Czech cuisine in lovely surroundings.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel, great location

reviews.text: We also made use of the Hotel transfer facility to and from the Airport, which cost approx. £20 per one way trip, which we felt was excellent value between 4 people.
reviews.title: absolutely fantastic

likes.liked: — modern and very clean with non smoking rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the Josef for three nights, and were happily surprised by the high level of service experienced. The hotel is very stylish, with helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Super service

likes.disliked: — Limited onsite dining options for the evening

reviews.text: A nice touch was the fruit on the reception desk. Breakfast was amazing - all you could ever imagine. Rooms were large, as are the bathrooms. Good quality furnishings and linen have been used throughout.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — Really high quality finish, staff and service

reviews.text: The hotel is a few minutes walk from the old town square, a great location. There is a small garden area where you can relax away from the frantic streets of Prague.
reviews.title: Small but perfect location

likes.disliked: — Will not harm to be a little more professional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a definite on the 'return to' list.
reviews.title: Love the Josef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in to check out stay was fabulous. There were 6 of us staying at the Josef for a 50th birthday celebration in beautiful Prague.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a three night stay at the Josef and loved the whole feel of the place. It is very upbeat and hip and a nice modern contrast to the Old City next to it. We had a room in the "pink house" on the 8th floor (top floor) and definitely recommend that as you get so much light inside and have a balcony if it is warm enough to use it. The staff is lovely here, extremely helpful and we put them to work. The concierge helped us out a lot and was really nice and even receptive to taking some tips from us on places she didn't already know about (i.e. Oliva Restaurant). The business center offered free internet in a great setting with people watching while you are there and free bottled water all around the hotel, a fantastic feature that we so appreciated. The breakfast was good and in a very tranquil and lovely space looking over a small green courtyard, and we actually got to eat outside the last day which is always a treat for me. English newpapers as well, also a nice touch that we didn't see many other places on our vacation. The gym was decent and we used it, nice big screen tv in there while you work out. I also had a massage at their sister hotel, the Maximillian, which was really great as well. We recommend this hotel very, very highly.
reviews.title: Modern and fun hotel in Prague

reviews.text: I was in Prague last week. My parents stayed in the Hotel Josef and we stayed in a less expensive hotel nearby. We had a good look around their room and the whole hotel,and it's great. The rooms are great - really modern with cool, clean sleek lines but still comfortable and welcoming. The reception foyer has plenty of seating and a small bar which seems well used by the residents. It's only about a 5 minute (max) walk to the old town square, so not as central as some hotels, but it was very peaceful - there wasn't a single noise to be heard at 11pm.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast were excellent with lots of choice, and the option of eating in the central garden where there are tables when the weather is good.
reviews.title: Wonderful and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for my Dad's birthday, and the hotel left a complementary half bottle of champagne and bowl of stramberries in their room for them. They do like their creature comforts, and loved this hotel!
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: Hotel Josef has a terrific location and is perhaps the most comfortable hotel I have ever stayed in. The decor is sleek, and the front desk is very helpful. Our nonsmoking room was quiet and had great details (heated bathroom floor and towel racks, good lighting, and the most comfortable mattress I have ever slept on in a hotel). We took full advantage of the free internet access in the "business center". The breakfast was nice with plenty of options (including a large array of fresh fruits) and the service very efficient. The hotel has a great location - walking distance to nearly every place we visited during our 4 days in Prague. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: The hotel certainly has the mood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and myself stayed at the Josef in July 2006. We enjoyed it so much we booked a stay for our eldest son (aged 20) and his girlfriend as a treat.
reviews.title: a delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm happy to report that their experience was as positive as our own. They were given a free upgrade to a superior room and treated very well by the staff during their stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel in a very good location

reviews.text: Ultra modern rooms with heavenly air conditioning and a delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: A Modern Oasis in an Ancient City

reviews.text: This a sophisticated boutique hotel situated on the fringe of the Jewish Quarter and only a 4 minute walk from the Old Town Square. Situated on a calm street just behind the Kotva dept store and next to a police station, from the minute you walk in staff are friendly and attentive. The hotel's decor is modern, minimalist but practical. Once you are checked in and your room is ready, a member of staff gives you a quick guided tour of the facilities which include a 24 hour business centre (free internet access), a beautiful courtyard garden between the two buildings that make up the hotel, a breakfast room which overlooks this, and a gym (which we didn't use - no need for extra exercise when you are pounding the streets in 100 degree sun!). Our room was a superior room in the Orange House. It did have a separate glass walk-in shower but this was not 'see-through' as depicted in the hotel website. Water did leak out from the shower which did soak some of the towels and the toiletries were not the Aveda products they advertise on their site. However, the bathroom was clean and looked good. The room itself was a pretty good size. The bed was king-size and the room overlooked the courtyard so there was no noise to speak of. On the outside of the windows are electrically operated sun shades which you can lower and raise to your hearts content. Superior rooms come with free DVD rental from their video library although we were initially mistakenly charged for this. They are quick to fix such problems like this and the fact that our room was not serviced one day. Normally there is a turn-down service and fresh bottles of water provided. Plenty of good restaurants in the surrounding streets and it seemed a safe area to walk around - never saw one drunk. Breakfast is expensive - 500 crowns - and was not included in our hotels.com package so watch out for that. The breakfast itself is excellent though with lots of fresh fruits and items cooked to order. Staff speak good English. To sum up - the Hotel Josef is a good hotel for the price, very service-orientated in a city where that is sorely missing still, good location, quiet, helpful and relatively luxurious. 4/5
reviews.title: Super stay at Josef

reviews.text: Hotel Josef is incredibly modern. The rooms are air-conditioned and soundproof and again it was like being in a Kohler bathroom showroom! Ulta-modern!
reviews.title: Great place and great service

likes.liked: — Clean rooms in a great location, Style
likes.disliked: — Room could have been on a higher floor

description: In the very heart of one of the most beautiful medieval cities in Europe, designer Eva Jiricna has managed to create a modern masterpiece. The 109-room Hotel Josef in Prague's old town offers a design concept that elegantly blends the most modern elements with the rich history of its surroundings. iPod Docking Stations are available free of charge at reception.
